title: Drew Conley Youtube channel
blurb: YouTube channel dedicated to Game Development using JavaScript or Godot game engine.

title: Interface in Game
blurb: An extensive collection of interfaces across various games and genres

title: Game UI Database
blurb: An extensive collection of interfaces across various games and genres

title: Kenney Assets
blurb: Kenney has created thousands of sprites, 3D models and sound effects which you can use in your projects. The generous public domain license allows any kind of use, even commercial!

title: Aseprite
blurb: Animated sprite editor & pixel art tool

title: Peter Milko - Pixel Art 101
blurb: Peter Milko Youtube's series for pixel art beginner using Aseprite

title: AdamCYounis - Pixel Art Class
blurb: AdamCYounis Youtube's series for pixel art beginner using Aseprite

title: Brandon James Greer Youtube Channel
blurb: Technical aspects and design choices behind pixel art construction, tutorials, timelapses, and concept-to-completion of pixel art pieces!

title: Steam Quirks For Developers
blurb: Tom Francis (Gunpoint, Heat Signature) calls out some nice-to-know bits of information when preparing for a Steam release

title: itch.io
blurb: An excellent resource for both free and paid assets. Includes 2D, 3D, music, sound effects and even tools

title: Navmesh pathfinding
blurb: A plugin for path-finding in JS using navmeshes, with wrappers for Phaser 3 and Phaser 2

title: HUDS+GUIS
blurb: HUDS+GUIS is a site with the most creative and interesting examples of UI design. Sources are films, TV and games

title: Why do I need a local web server for gamedev?
blurb:
A common question when doing local dev is why do we need a local web server? 

Phaser has an excellent explanation in their getting started guide
